Module MathUtils
Package mathUtils.calculus

Class Polynomial.Term

java.lang.Object
mathUtils.calculus.Polynomial.Term
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Polynomial.Term>
Enclosing class:
Polynomial
public static class Polynomial.Term
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Polynomial.Term>
This class represents a term of a polynomial. Each term consists of a coefficient and an exponent. A term can therefore be expressed as \( ax^n \), where \( a \) is the coefficient, \( n \) is the exponent and \( x \) is a real number that determines the term's value. This class implements the Comparable interface, which compares the terms' exponents, so that, in a polynomial of terms, they can be ordered by their degree. Each term's coefficient and exponent are publicly accessible, so to allow a more versatile use of this class. Note that methods like add(Term t) or sqrt() change the structure of this term; Therefore, to correctly perform calculations without losing this term's current data, use the copy-constructor as follows:

Term t1 = new Term(5, 2); //value: 5x^2
Term t2 = new Term(t1); //value: 5x^2
t1.square();
//value of t1: 25x^4
//value of t2: 5x^2

    • add

      public Polynomial.Term add​(Polynomial.Term t)
      Adds the given terms. Generally, it is said that:
      \( ax^n + bx^n = (a+b)x^n \)
      Therefore, if the terms' exponents are not equal, null is returned instead.
      Parameters:
      t - The term to add
      Returns:
      The terms' sum

    • subtract

      public Polynomial.Term subtract​(Polynomial.Term t)
      Subtracts the given term from this term. Generally, it is said that:
      \( ax^n - bx^n = (a-b)x^n \)
      Therefore, if the terms' exponents are not equal, null is returned instead.
      Parameters:
      t - The term to subtract from this term
      Returns:
      The terms' difference

    • multiply

      public Polynomial.Term multiply​(Polynomial.Term t)
      Multiplies the given term with this term. Generally, it is said that:
      \( ax^n \cdot bx^m = (a \cdot b)x^{n + m} \)
      Parameters:
      t - The term to multiply with this term
      Returns:
      The terms' product

    • divide

      public Polynomial.Term divide​(Polynomial.Term t)
      Divides this term by the given term. Generally, it is said that:
      \( ax^n \div bx^m = (a \div b)x^{n - m} \)
      Therefore, if the terms' exponents are not equal, null is returned instead.
      Parameters:
      t - The term to subtract from this term
      Returns:
      The terms' difference

    • pow

      public Polynomial.Term pow​(double n)
      Takes this term to its n-th power. Here, the term is multiplied by itself for the required amount of times, so it iteratively invokes the multiply(Term t) method. After the calculations, this term is returned to efficiently allow a versatile use of this class.
      Parameters:
      n - The exponent
      Returns:
      The power of this term

    • square

      public Polynomial.Term square()
      Squares this term. After the calculations, this term is returned as a result, so to allow functional, stream-like use of this class.
      Returns:
      The square of this term

    • root

      public Polynomial.Term root​(double n)
      Calculates the n-th root of this term. After the calculations, this term is then returned, so to allow functional, stream-like use of this class.
      Parameters:
      n - The root
      Returns:
      The n-th root of this term

    • sqrt

      public Polynomial.Term sqrt()
      Calculates the square root of this term. After the calculations, this term is then returned, so to allow functional, stream-like use of this class.
      Returns:
      The square root of this term

    • derivative

      public Polynomial.Term derivative()
      Computes the derivative of this term. The derivative of a function \( f(x) \) indicates the rate of increase at any given point \( x \). It is computed as:
      \( \dfrac{d}{dx}ax^b = ab \cdot x^{b-1} \)
      Returns:
      The derivative of this term as a new term

    • derivative

      public Polynomial.Term derivative​(int n)
      Computes the n-th derivative of this term. The derivative of a function \( f(x) \) indicates the rate of increase at any given point \( x \). It is computed as:
      \( \dfrac{d}{dx}ax^b = ab \cdot x^{b-1} \)
      Parameters:
      n - The number of times to differentiate this term
      Returns:
      The n-th derivative of this term as a new term

    • integral

      public Polynomial.Term integral()
      Computes the integral of this term. The integral of a function \( f(x) \) indicates the area under the curve of the function from \( 0 \) to \( x \). It is computed as:
      \( \displaystyle\int (ax^b)dx = \dfrac{a}{b+1}x^{b+1} \)
      Returns:
      The integral of this term as a new term

    • integral

      public Polynomial.Term integral​(int n)
      Computes the n-th integral of this term. The integral of a function \( f(x) \) indicates the area under the curve of the function from \( 0 \) to \( x \). It is computed as:
      \( \displaystyle\int (ax^b)dx = \dfrac{a}{b+1}x^{b+1} \)
      Parameters:
      n - The number of times to differentiate
      Returns:
      The n-th integral of this term as a new term

    • toFunction

      public Function toFunction()
      Converts this term to a Function. It is identical to \( f(x) = ax^b \), where \( a \) is the term's coefficient, \( b \) is the term's exponent (or degree) and \( f(x) \) is the returned function.
      Returns:
      A Function that represents this term

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Evaluates this polynomial's equality. If the given Object is not an instance of Polynomial.Term, then false is returned. Otherwise, returns weather or not both coefficients and exponents are equal. Returns false otherwise.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to test for equality with
      Returns:
      This object's equality with the given object

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Polynomial.Term o)
      Compares this object with the specified object for order. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.

      The implementor must ensure sgn(x.compareTo(y)) == -sgn(y.compareTo(x)) for all x and y. (This implies that x.compareTo(y) must throw an exception iff y.compareTo(x) throws an exception.)

      The implementor must also ensure that the relation is transitive: (x.compareTo(y) > 0 && y.compareTo(z) > 0) implies x.compareTo(z) > 0.

      Finally, the implementor must ensure that x.compareTo(y)==0 implies that sgn(x.compareTo(z)) == sgn(y.compareTo(z)), for all z.

      It is strongly recommended, but not strictly required that (x.compareTo(y)==0) == (x.equals(y)). Generally speaking, any class that implements the Comparable interface and violates this condition should clearly indicate this fact. The recommended language is "Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals."

      In the foregoing description, the notation sgn(expression) designates the mathematical signum function, which is defined to return one of -1, 0, or 1 according to whether the value of expression is negative, zero, or positive, respectively.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Polynomial.Term>
      Parameters:
      o - the object to be compared.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified object is null
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the specified object's type prevents it from being compared to this object.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Parses this term as a String. Generally, it is returned as ax^b. If the coefficient is 0, then "0" is returned. If the exponent is 0, then 'x^b' is left out. If the exponent is 1, then '^b' is left out.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      This term as a String

    • valueOf

      public double valueOf​(double x)
      Evaluates this term at the given point x. Since a term can be expressed in form of \( T(x) = ax^b \), this method calculates the value of the function with the given x-value.
      Parameters:
      x - The value of x
      Returns:
      The function at the given x
